New Records: Tommy Kahnle allowed a go-ahead, two-run homer to Bryan Reynolds in the eighth inning
Key Match Events: Jazz Chisholm Jr. gave the Yankees a 2-0 lead with a two-run single in the fifth
Nick Gonzalez and Bryan Reynolds hit back-to-back homers to open the sixth, wiping out the Yankees' 2-0 lead
Tommy Kahnle gave up a go-ahead, two-run homer to Reynolds and the Yankees couldn’t rally
Pre-Game Insights: The Yankees have clinched the AL East title and are closing in on home-field advantage through the ALCS
Gerrit Cole pitching like an ace of late and Carlos Rodon looking like a weapon for the postseason
Post-Match Reflections: Jazz Chisholm Jr. expressed the team’s lofty expectations once they get to October
Aaron Boone pulls Carlos Rodon during the Yankees’ loss to the Pirates on Sept. 27
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Yankees are still a bit of a work in progress, however, as Jasson Dominguez started again in left field and they rested Aaron Judge, Giancarlo Stanton, Austin Wells and Anthony Rizzo
Others: The night got off to a promising start as Rodon pitched out of trouble in the first on his way to holding the Pirates scoreless through five
Rodon was aided by two fantastic running catches on deep fly balls to center by Trent Grisham
